content.description: Start with some high holds in the dihedral (I had to fold my pad to reach them). Pull over and mantle onto the slab for a highball finish.
content.location: Right (east) side of the shady Lady Boulder.

content.description: Climb the south arete of the boulder. Most of the harder moves are about halfway up the slab, getting on could be  the hardest move.
content.protection: Pads and spotters, it's a ramp so it is hard ot pad.
content.location: Downclimb same as for Shady Lady.

content.description: This is the varnished western face of the boulder. Climb on great holds to a semi-tenuous topout.
content.protection: You don't need a pad, just don't fall.
content.location: The downclimb goes down the slabby finish to Front Right Mantle (V2). The first step down is a little tricky.

content.description: Start with a really cool heal throwing mantle by grabbing the jugs at just above head height. The vertically challenged may need to stack pads for the start. The slab is 5.9 or so once you mantle.
content.location: Just to the right of the Southern arete of the Shady Lady boulder.

content.description: The route starts on a crimpy seam and goes up through balancy moves to a slopey rail/ledge. It is cool for three reasons: it gets almost all day shade, it does not receive much traffic, and it has very technical and delicate movement.
content.location: Back (north) side of the Shady Lady Boulder.

content.description: The main line (Shady Lady, V2) on this boulder is a great one to do when you need some shade, hence the name. This is the large boulder on the Northwest side of the group of boulders containing the warmup boulder's. It is east of the cube, and can be seen easily from the east side of the Cube.
